intro: Palicourea velutina, commonly known as velvetleaf palicourea, is a climbing shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves that give it its common name. Its flowers are small, clustered, and typically white or pale yellow, while its fruits are small berries that turn red when mature. Palicourea velutina is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
